intro: Heliophytum brachystachyum, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed sunplant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its small, clustered flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
